BikeNet

web app design

“On a chilly November afternoon in 2013, a group of urban planners, graphic designers, business entrepreneurs, and interface developers gathered together in a bike shop in Urbana, IL. All of them had personal experiences with bike theft. All of them were frustrated by the ineffective system in place for recovering stolen bikes. It was through this combination of experience and frustration that BikeNet was born.” -Ricardo Pierre-Louis
BikeNet is a web, iOS, and Android app that is built by cyclists, designers, and engineers with a passion for fighting bike crime. I joined the team in February to design the BikeNet website, where a user can download the app, register a bike, report a theft, and view theft reports in their area. I worked with Andrew Haglund (UX design), Matthew Farrell (logo and visual design) Ricardo Pierre-Louis (mobile developer), Jacob Lagrou (web developer), and Miles Thomas (thesis on bicycle theft and cycling habits in Champaign-Urbana).
